ai-ps2.6:1.0_0: and rolled forth the Wheel of Dhamma.
ai-ps2.6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares in the deer park at Isipatana.
ai-ps2.6:2.1_0: “There are these two opposites that should not be pursued by one who has gone forth.
ai-ps2.6:2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-ps2.6:2.3_0: One is the devotion to worldly pleasures, which is inferior, common, for the ordinary person, ignoble, and unbeneficial.
ai-ps2.6:2.4_0: and one who is in self-mortification is painful, ignoble, and pointless.
ai-ps2.6:2.5_0: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the middle way of practice, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-ps2.6:3.1_0: And what is that middle way of practice?
ai-ps2.6:3.2_0: It’s just this noble eightfold path,
ai-ps2.6:3.3_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-ps2.6:3.4_0: This is that middle way of practice, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-ps2.6:4.1_0: And this is noble truth of suffering:
ai-ps2.6:4.2_0: birth is suffering, old age is suffering, sickness is suffering, death is suffering, association with what is disliked is suffering, separation from what is liked is suffering, not getting what one wants is suffering.
ai-ps2.6:4.3_0: In brief, the five grasping aggregates are suffering.
ai-ps2.6:4.4_0: Now this is the noble truth of the origin of suffering.
ai-ps2.6:4.5_0: It’s the craving that leads to future lives, mixed up with relishing and greed, taking pleasure in various different realms. That is,
ai-ps2.6:4.6_0: for sensual pleasures, to continue existence, and to end existence.
ai-ps2.6:4.7_0: Now this is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.
ai-ps2.6:4.8_0: It’s the fading away and cessation of that very same craving with nothing left over; giving it away, letting it go, releasing it, and not adhering to it.
ai-ps2.6:4.9_0: Now this is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-ps2.6:4.10_0: It’s just this noble eightfold path,
ai-ps2.6:4.11_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-ps2.6:5.1_0: ‘This is the noble truth of suffering.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
ai-ps2.6:5.2_0: ‘This noble truth of suffering should be completely understood.’ ...
ai-ps2.6:5.3_0: Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.

ai-ps2.6:6.2_0: ‘This noble truth of the origin of suffering should be given up.’ ...
ai-ps2.6:6.3_0: When I knew that this was the vision, knowledge arose, wisdom arose, understanding arose, and light arose, in regard to things not heard before.
ai-ps2.6:7.1_0: ‘This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.’ Such was the vision that arose in me ...
ai-ps2.6:7.2_0: ‘This noble truth of the cessation of suffering should be realized.’ Such was the vision that leads to my cessation of suffering.
ai-ps2.6:7.3_0: When I knew the truth, vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
ai-ps2.6:8.1_0: ‘This is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’ Such was the vision that arose in me ...

ai-ps2.6:8.3_0: When I knew that this was the vision, knowledge arose, wisdom arose, understanding arose, and light arose, in regard to things not heard before.
ai-ps2.6:9.1_0: As long as my true knowledge and vision about these four noble truths was not fully purified in these three perspectives and twelve respects, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-ps2.6:10.1_0: But when my true knowledge and vision about these four noble truths was fully purified in these three perspectives and twelve respects, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
ai-ps2.6:10.2_0: the knowledge and vision arose in me:
ai-ps2.6:10.3_0: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
ai-ps2.6:11.1_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-ps2.6:11.2_0: Satisfied, the group of five mendicants was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-ps2.6:12.1_0: And while this exposition was being spoken, Venerable Koṇḍañña experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:
ai-ps2.6:12.2_0: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”
ai-ps2.6:13.1_0: When the Buddha had set rolling the wheel of the Teaching, the earth gods cried out,
ai-ps2.6:13.2_0: “At Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana, the Buddha has set rolling the supreme wheel of the Teaching. It can’t be stopped by any ascetic, brahmin, god, lord of death, supreme being, or anyone in the world.”
